Bravo, Michael Graff et co.! I recently added simple metrics (healthz, traffic, analysis) for a monitoring service while SLOs were being defined by others. That got me thinking about how to map SLOs <-> SLIs and KPIs <-> metrics <-> registers via OTel collectors (DPU/GPU/CPU HW/SW interfaces, anyone?). But then it got me thinking about how one would monitor dynamic HW/SW elements in a heterogeneous AI Infra fabric, leading to my current investigation of out-of-band management using OpenBMC on an evb-ast2600 board using Qemu-based HW emulation. Chip sounds like an important component in such a solution! And veddy much just in time! Congrats and thanks! ğŸ—ï¸ğŸ¤“ğŸ‰

Can you really get hired from anywhere in the world?As I learnt, it's one of the toughest questions to answer in the recruitment world. The details are fuzzy, bias is always seeping into the supposedly fair assessment of equal employment opportunities (spoiler alert!), and we sort of... just roll with the punches in Africa.I enjoyed exploring this question with knowledgeable folks and wonderful community who shared their experiences with me, and pitched this story in the first place.Let's make Digital Nomads even better.I'm looking to explore more topical issues around housing, economy, and tech in African hubs and how nomads impact these different dimensions.Let's talk hashtag#Nomads; send a message.And ohâ€”the answer to the question I opened with is more systemic and rather circumstantial than I'd imagined. What are the odds for Africans living and working from the continent?I talk about it here: https://lnkd.in/dRwmT3V7What's your experience with "location-adjusted" pay?

welcome back Ø¹Ø¯Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠØ¨Ø© ğŸ˜… ğŸš€ Next Step: SWE.2 â€“ From Requirement to Architecture and Model! ğŸš€Iâ€™m thrilled to share the next phase of my MBD diploma project from OS-Academy â€“ : SWE.2 â€“ Software Architecture Design! ğŸš€In this stage, weâ€™ll take the system requirements defined in SWE.1 and build a modular, maintainable architecture that steers implementation, testing, and future evolution.Hereâ€™s what to expect:1ï¸âƒ£ Architectural Views Break the system into clear functional blocks and define their responsibilities:ğŸ”¹Main State Machine Manages core logic and coordinates inter-module communication.ğŸ”¹Current Limits Calculator Computes safe charge/discharge thresholds based on real-time data.ğŸ”¹SOC & SOH Estimators Tracks battery state-of-charge and state-of-health.ğŸ”¹Balancing Logic Ensures individual cell voltages stay synchronized.2ï¸âƒ£ Interfaces & Data FlowsMap each domain into software modules/packages with precise contracts: ğŸ”¹ Defined fixed-rate tasks(50 ms â” MainSM, 100 ms â” LimitsCalc, 200 ms â” SOC/SOH estimators, 250 ms â” Balancing) ğŸ”¹ Route signals (voltage, temperature, current) via buses and ZOH blocks ğŸ”¹ Store each signal in the Data Dictionary as ğŸ”„ a MTP Signals: (ImportedExtern (inputs) - ExportedToFile (logging) - Localized (module-internal))3ï¸âƒ£ Modeling & PrototypingLeverage MATLAB/Simulink & Stateflow to:ğŸ”¹Prototype each core module and simulate their interactions.ğŸ”¹Auto-generate architecture diagrams directly from models.ğŸ”¹Run Model Advisor checks for MISRA C compliance, execution efficiency, and RAM usage.4ï¸âƒ£ Verification AlignmentEmbed test hooks and traceability throughout:ğŸ”¹MIL/SIL Test Harnesses for unit, integration, and system-level validation.ğŸ”¹Full Requirements â†” Architecture â†” Test Case traceability matrices.ğŸ”¹Automated test-management reports to track coverage and results.ğŸ” Why it matters A well-crafted software architecture is the backbone of a reliable project â€”it makes implementation easier to develop, verify, and evolve. By nailing this SWE.2 step, we set ourselves up for smoother integration (SWE.3) and rigorous validation (SWE.4).ğŸ”— the GitHub Repo: https://lnkd.in/dpww-PjNStay tuned for SWE.3, where we dive into detailed design and implementation, plus start exploring our battery and planetary models! ğŸŒğŸ”‹hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#MBD hashtag#VModel hashtag#SWE2 hashtag#EmbeddedSystems hashtag#MATLABSimulink hashtag#BMS

Bravo, Michael Graff et co.! I recently added simple metrics (healthz, traffic, analysis) for a monitoring service while SLOs were being defined by others. That got me thinking about how to map SLOs <-> SLIs and KPIs <-> metrics <-> registers via OTel collectors (DPU/GPU/CPU HW/SW interfaces, anyone?). But then it got me thinking about how one would monitor dynamic HW/SW elements in a heterogeneous AI Infra fabric, leading to my current investigation of out-of-band management using OpenBMC on an evb-ast2600 board using Qemu-based HW emulation. Chip sounds like an important component in such a solution! And veddy much just in time! Congrats and thanks! ğŸ—ï¸ğŸ¤“ğŸ‰

Can you really get hired from anywhere in the world?As I learnt, it's one of the toughest questions to answer in the recruitment world. The details are fuzzy, bias is always seeping into the supposedly fair assessment of equal employment opportunities (spoiler alert!), and we sort of... just roll with the punches in Africa.I enjoyed exploring this question with knowledgeable folks and wonderful community who shared their experiences with me, and pitched this story in the first place.Let's make Digital Nomads even better.I'm looking to explore more topical issues around housing, economy, and tech in African hubs and how nomads impact these different dimensions.Let's talk hashtag#Nomads; send a message.And ohâ€”the answer to the question I opened with is more systemic and rather circumstantial than I'd imagined. What are the odds for Africans living and working from the continent?I talk about it here: https://lnkd.in/dRwmT3V7What's your experience with "location-adjusted" pay?

GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? How have you approached synchronization and reconciliation across devices and backends?Checkout Amethyst Planner - the task app for hashtag#ADHDers the turns to-dos into dopamine.

For many developers, firmware is a given, constraints that must be obeyed in production software.Â â€œBare-Metal Embedded C Programmingâ€ ( Packt , 2025) by Israel Ninsaw Gbati demonstrates, at a fundamental level, how coding firmware by directly activating system microcontrollers should be merely another step in the production process.Â Â The book consists of 18 chapters, starting with the basics, then discussing timers and system peripherals, before briefly touching on power management.Â I recommend this for any developer looking to extract the maximum performance from their coding. hashtag#baremetal hashtag#C hashtag#Software hashtag#firmware hashtag#Packt

Next, kita try module CH376S for this D0WD-v3 ESP32 which this MC very likely act as isolated network device, BUT possibility to send log about isolated network activity via COM, so boleh act sbg intermediary bagi pihak host2 dalam network dia sahaja dengan syarat physical connected dengan driver tertentu (COM) .. cumanya, kena tambah CH376S USB Module storage ntk keep logging â€˜somethingâ€™ and send to â€˜outside worldâ€™ via COM or guna STA sbb AP ntk MC ni xdpt nak implement full NAT Routing Capabilties ..But, this device boleh buat DDOS dengan capture packet, deauther develop by rinisek, could be Deauther ni operate in Layer 2 OSI, which is spam packets, frame injection, MAC Spoofing things, satu WiFi Radio dah boleh, but NAT Routing more to Layer 3 OSI & TCP/UDP ops, kena dual jugak WiFi Radio .. klu sketch Full NAT Implement tak boleh kat DW0D-V3, means sia2 sketch DNS Hijack, imo .. ğŸ˜µâ€ğŸ’«But this device sangat sesuai untuk OT Environment, same like SCADA, ASRS etc untuk logging and update, so dapat reduce penggunaan device yang mahal2 like router yang boleh expose TCP Stack, like my previous experience, 8 Crane Controller update logs to WMS Workload through Outdate MOXA Router, lol .. duit pun kena hentam kaw2 dengan vendor ntk maintenance, lambat satu hal, lagi besar attack surface beranak pinak satu hal .. teringat Moxa OS Zero-Day Exploit (RCE) last year, should fixed already ..hashtag#esp32 hashtag#microcontroller hashtag#learning hashtag#networksecurity

Can you really get hired from anywhere in the world?As I learnt, it's one of the toughest questions to answer in the recruitment world. welcome back Ø¹Ø¯Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠØ¨Ø© ğŸ˜… ğŸš€ Next Step: SWE.2 â€“ From Requirement to Architecture and Model! ğŸš€Iâ€™m thrilled to share the next phase of my MBD diploma project from OS-Academy â€“ : SWE.2 â€“ Software Architecture Design! ğŸš€In this stage, weâ€™ll take the system requirements defined in SWE.1 and build a modular, maintainable architecture that steers implementation, testing, and future evolution.Hereâ€™s what to expect:1ï¸âƒ£ Architectural Views Break the system into clear functional blocks and define their responsibilities:ğŸ”¹Main State Machine Manages core logic and coordinates inter-module communication.ğŸ”¹Current Limits Calculator Computes safe charge/discharge thresholds based on real-time data.ğŸ”¹SOC & SOH Estimators Tracks battery state-of-charge and state-of-health.ğŸ”¹Balancing Logic Ensures individual cell voltages stay synchronized.2ï¸âƒ£ Interfaces & Data FlowsMap each domain into software modules/packages with precise contracts: ğŸ”¹ Defined fixed-rate tasks(50 ms â” MainSM, 100 ms â” LimitsCalc, 200 ms â” SOC/SOH estimators, 250 ms â” Balancing) ğŸ”¹ Route signals (voltage, temperature, current) via buses and ZOH blocks ğŸ”¹ Store each signal in the Data Dictionary as ğŸ”„ a MTP Signals: (ImportedExtern (inputs) - ExportedToFile (logging) - Localized (module-internal))3ï¸âƒ£ Modeling & PrototypingLeverage MATLAB/Simulink & Stateflow to:ğŸ”¹Prototype each core module and simulate their interactions.ğŸ”¹Auto-generate architecture diagrams directly from models.ğŸ”¹Run Model Advisor checks for MISRA C compliance, execution efficiency, and RAM usage.4ï¸âƒ£ Verification AlignmentEmbed test hooks and traceability throughout:ğŸ”¹MIL/SIL Test Harnesses for unit, integration, and system-level validation.ğŸ”¹Full Requirements â†” Architecture â†” Test Case traceability matrices.ğŸ”¹Automated test-management reports to track coverage and results.ğŸ” Why it matters A well-crafted software architecture is the backbone of a reliable project â€”it makes implementation easier to develop, verify, and evolve. By nailing this SWE.2 step, we set ourselves up for smoother integration (SWE.3) and rigorous validation (SWE.4).ğŸ”— the GitHub Repo: https://lnkd.in/dpww-PjNStay tuned for SWE.3, where we dive into detailed design and implementation, plus start exploring our battery and planetary models! ğŸŒğŸ”‹hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#MBD hashtag#VModel hashtag#SWE2 hashtag#EmbeddedSystems hashtag#MATLABSimulink hashtag#BMS

GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? How have you approached synchronization and reconciliation across devices and backends?Checkout Amethyst Planner - the task app for hashtag#ADHDers the turns to-dos into dopamine.

Next, kita try module CH376S for this D0WD-v3 ESP32 which this MC very likely act as isolated network device, BUT possibility to send log about isolated network activity via COM, so boleh act sbg intermediary bagi pihak host2 dalam network dia sahaja dengan syarat physical connected dengan driver tertentu (COM) .. cumanya, kena tambah CH376S USB Module storage ntk keep logging â€˜somethingâ€™ and send to â€˜outside worldâ€™ via COM or guna STA sbb AP ntk MC ni xdpt nak implement full NAT Routing Capabilties ..But, this device boleh buat DDOS dengan capture packet, deauther develop by rinisek, could be Deauther ni operate in Layer 2 OSI, which is spam packets, frame injection, MAC Spoofing things, satu WiFi Radio dah boleh, but NAT Routing more to Layer 3 OSI & TCP/UDP ops, kena dual jugak WiFi Radio .. klu sketch Full NAT Implement tak boleh kat DW0D-V3, means sia2 sketch DNS Hijack, imo .. ğŸ˜µâ€ğŸ’«But this device sangat sesuai untuk OT Environment, same like SCADA, ASRS etc untuk logging and update, so dapat reduce penggunaan device yang mahal2 like router yang boleh expose TCP Stack, like my previous experience, 8 Crane Controller update logs to WMS Workload through Outdate MOXA Router, lol .. duit pun kena hentam kaw2 dengan vendor ntk maintenance, lambat satu hal, lagi besar attack surface beranak pinak satu hal .. teringat Moxa OS Zero-Day Exploit (RCE) last year, should fixed already ..hashtag#esp32 hashtag#microcontroller hashtag#learning hashtag#networksecurity

welcome back Ø¹Ø¯Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠØ¨Ø© ğŸ˜… ğŸš€ Next Step: SWE.2 â€“ From Requirement to Architecture and Model! ğŸš€Iâ€™m thrilled to share the next phase of my MBD diploma project from OS-Academy â€“ : SWE.2 â€“ Software Architecture Design! ğŸš€In this stage, weâ€™ll take the system requirements defined in SWE.1 and build a modular, maintainable architecture that steers implementation, testing, and future evolution.Hereâ€™s what to expect:1ï¸âƒ£ Architectural Views Break the system into clear functional blocks and define their responsibilities:ğŸ”¹Main State Machine Manages core logic and coordinates inter-module communication.ğŸ”¹Current Limits Calculator Computes safe charge/discharge thresholds based on real-time data.ğŸ”¹SOC & SOH Estimators Tracks battery state-of-charge and state-of-health.ğŸ”¹Balancing Logic Ensures individual cell voltages stay synchronized.2ï¸âƒ£ Interfaces & Data FlowsMap each domain into software modules/packages with precise contracts: ğŸ”¹ Defined fixed-rate tasks(50 ms â” MainSM, 100 ms â” LimitsCalc, 200 ms â” SOC/SOH estimators, 250 ms â” Balancing) ğŸ”¹ Route signals (voltage, temperature, current) via buses and ZOH blocks ğŸ”¹ Store each signal in the Data Dictionary as ğŸ”„ a MTP Signals: (ImportedExtern (inputs) - ExportedToFile (logging) - Localized (module-internal))3ï¸âƒ£ Modeling & PrototypingLeverage MATLAB/Simulink & Stateflow to:ğŸ”¹Prototype each core module and simulate their interactions.ğŸ”¹Auto-generate architecture diagrams directly from models.ğŸ”¹Run Model Advisor checks for MISRA C compliance, execution efficiency, and RAM usage.4ï¸âƒ£ Verification AlignmentEmbed test hooks and traceability throughout:ğŸ”¹MIL/SIL Test Harnesses for unit, integration, and system-level validation.ğŸ”¹Full Requirements â†” Architecture â†” Test Case traceability matrices.ğŸ”¹Automated test-management reports to track coverage and results.ğŸ” Why it matters A well-crafted software architecture is the backbone of a reliable project â€”it makes implementation easier to develop, verify, and evolve. By nailing this SWE.2 step, we set ourselves up for smoother integration (SWE.3) and rigorous validation (SWE.4).ğŸ”— the GitHub Repo: https://lnkd.in/dpww-PjNStay tuned for SWE.3, where we dive into detailed design and implementation, plus start exploring our battery and planetary models! ğŸŒğŸ”‹hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#MBD hashtag#VModel hashtag#SWE2 hashtag#EmbeddedSystems hashtag#MATLABSimulink hashtag#BMS

GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? How have you approached synchronization and reconciliation across devices and backends?Checkout Amethyst Planner - the task app for hashtag#ADHDers the turns to-dos into dopamine.

Next, kita try module CH376S for this D0WD-v3 ESP32 which this MC very likely act as isolated network device, BUT possibility to send log about isolated network activity via COM, so boleh act sbg intermediary bagi pihak host2 dalam network dia sahaja dengan syarat physical connected dengan driver tertentu (COM) .. cumanya, kena tambah CH376S USB Module storage ntk keep logging â€˜somethingâ€™ and send to â€˜outside worldâ€™ via COM or guna STA sbb AP ntk MC ni xdpt nak implement full NAT Routing Capabilties ..But, this device boleh buat DDOS dengan capture packet, deauther develop by rinisek, could be Deauther ni operate in Layer 2 OSI, which is spam packets, frame injection, MAC Spoofing things, satu WiFi Radio dah boleh, but NAT Routing more to Layer 3 OSI & TCP/UDP ops, kena dual jugak WiFi Radio .. klu sketch Full NAT Implement tak boleh kat DW0D-V3, means sia2 sketch DNS Hijack, imo .. ğŸ˜µâ€ğŸ’«But this device sangat sesuai untuk OT Environment, same like SCADA, ASRS etc untuk logging and update, so dapat reduce penggunaan device yang mahal2 like router yang boleh expose TCP Stack, like my previous experience, 8 Crane Controller update logs to WMS Workload through Outdate MOXA Router, lol .. duit pun kena hentam kaw2 dengan vendor ntk maintenance, lambat satu hal, lagi besar attack surface beranak pinak satu hal .. teringat Moxa OS Zero-Day Exploit (RCE) last year, should fixed already ..hashtag#esp32 hashtag#microcontroller hashtag#learning hashtag#networksecurity

welcome back Ø¹Ø¯Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠØ¨Ø© ğŸ˜… ğŸš€ Next Step: SWE.2 â€“ From Requirement to Architecture and Model! ğŸš€Iâ€™m thrilled to share the next phase of my MBD diploma project from OS-Academy â€“ : SWE.2 â€“ Software Architecture Design! ğŸš€In this stage, weâ€™ll take the system requirements defined in SWE.1 and build a modular, maintainable architecture that steers implementation, testing, and future evolution.Hereâ€™s what to expect:1ï¸âƒ£ Architectural Views Break the system into clear functional blocks and define their responsibilities:ğŸ”¹Main State Machine Manages core logic and coordinates inter-module communication.ğŸ”¹Current Limits Calculator Computes safe charge/discharge thresholds based on real-time data.ğŸ”¹SOC & SOH Estimators Tracks battery state-of-charge and state-of-health.ğŸ”¹Balancing Logic Ensures individual cell voltages stay synchronized.2ï¸âƒ£ Interfaces & Data FlowsMap each domain into software modules/packages with precise contracts: ğŸ”¹ Defined fixed-rate tasks(50 ms â” MainSM, 100 ms â” LimitsCalc, 200 ms â” SOC/SOH estimators, 250 ms â” Balancing) ğŸ”¹ Route signals (voltage, temperature, current) via buses and ZOH blocks ğŸ”¹ Store each signal in the Data Dictionary as ğŸ”„ a MTP Signals: (ImportedExtern (inputs) - ExportedToFile (logging) - Localized (module-internal))3ï¸âƒ£ Modeling & PrototypingLeverage MATLAB/Simulink & Stateflow to:ğŸ”¹Prototype each core module and simulate their interactions.ğŸ”¹Auto-generate architecture diagrams directly from models.ğŸ”¹Run Model Advisor checks for MISRA C compliance, execution efficiency, and RAM usage.4ï¸âƒ£ Verification AlignmentEmbed test hooks and traceability throughout:ğŸ”¹MIL/SIL Test Harnesses for unit, integration, and system-level validation.ğŸ”¹Full Requirements â†” Architecture â†” Test Case traceability matrices.ğŸ”¹Automated test-management reports to track coverage and results.ğŸ” Why it matters A well-crafted software architecture is the backbone of a reliable project â€”it makes implementation easier to develop, verify, and evolve. By nailing this SWE.2 step, we set ourselves up for smoother integration (SWE.3) and rigorous validation (SWE.4).ğŸ”— the GitHub Repo: https://lnkd.in/dpww-PjNStay tuned for SWE.3, where we dive into detailed design and implementation, plus start exploring our battery and planetary models! ğŸŒğŸ”‹hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#MBD hashtag#VModel hashtag#SWE2 hashtag#EmbeddedSystems hashtag#MATLABSimulink hashtag#BMS

GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? How have you approached synchronization and reconciliation across devices and backends?Checkout Amethyst Planner - the task app for hashtag#ADHDers the turns to-dos into dopamine.

welcome back Ø¹Ø¯Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠØ¨Ø© ğŸ˜… ğŸš€ Next Step: SWE.2 â€“ From Requirement to Architecture and Model! ğŸš€Iâ€™m thrilled to share the next phase of my MBD diploma project from OS-Academy â€“ : SWE.2 â€“ Software Architecture Design! ğŸš€In this stage, weâ€™ll take the system requirements defined in SWE.1 and build a modular, maintainable architecture that steers implementation, testing, and future evolution.Hereâ€™s what to expect:1ï¸âƒ£ Architectural Views Break the system into clear functional blocks and define their responsibilities:ğŸ”¹Main State Machine Manages core logic and coordinates inter-module communication.ğŸ”¹Current Limits Calculator Computes safe charge/discharge thresholds based on real-time data.ğŸ”¹SOC & SOH Estimators Tracks battery state-of-charge and state-of-health.ğŸ”¹Balancing Logic Ensures individual cell voltages stay synchronized.2ï¸âƒ£ Interfaces & Data FlowsMap each domain into software modules/packages with precise contracts: ğŸ”¹ Defined fixed-rate tasks(50 ms â” MainSM, 100 ms â” LimitsCalc, 200 ms â” SOC/SOH estimators, 250 ms â” Balancing) ğŸ”¹ Route signals (voltage, temperature, current) via buses and ZOH blocks ğŸ”¹ Store each signal in the Data Dictionary as ğŸ”„ a MTP Signals: (ImportedExtern (inputs) - ExportedToFile (logging) - Localized (module-internal))3ï¸âƒ£ Modeling & PrototypingLeverage MATLAB/Simulink & Stateflow to:ğŸ”¹Prototype each core module and simulate their interactions.ğŸ”¹Auto-generate architecture diagrams directly from models.ğŸ”¹Run Model Advisor checks for MISRA C compliance, execution efficiency, and RAM usage.4ï¸âƒ£ Verification AlignmentEmbed test hooks and traceability throughout:ğŸ”¹MIL/SIL Test Harnesses for unit, integration, and system-level validation.ğŸ”¹Full Requirements â†” Architecture â†” Test Case traceability matrices.ğŸ”¹Automated test-management reports to track coverage and results.ğŸ” Why it matters A well-crafted software architecture is the backbone of a reliable project â€”it makes implementation easier to develop, verify, and evolve. GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? How have you approached synchronization and reconciliation across devices and backends?Checkout Amethyst Planner - the task app for hashtag#ADHDers the turns to-dos into dopamine.

Java 24: More than an update â€” a powerful step forward for modern software architecture. hashtag#LinkedInInsiderBRWith the official release of Java 24, Oracle continues to evolve the platform in ways that directly support today's demands for scalability, modularity, and cloud-native design. For professionals like me who architect systems with Hexagonal Architecture (DDD) and deploy on AWS, this release brings substantial benefits.ğŸš€ Key Features in Java 24:âœ… JEP 447 â€“ Statements before super(...) Allows initialization logic before calling the superclass constructor. This enhances flexibility in rich domain models and simplifies base-class inheritance patterns in DDD.âœ… JEP 456 â€“ Unnamed Variables and Patterns (Preview) Reduces boilerplate when using pattern matching, making business logic cleaner and more expressive.âœ… JEP 459 â€“ String Templates (Second Preview) Provides safe and efficient string interpolation â€” ideal for building dynamic responses, configurations, and messages without complex concatenation.âœ… JEP 460 â€“ Vector API (7th Incubator) Enables data-parallel operations for better performance in compute-heavy tasks â€” relevant for analytics or event-driven systems.âœ… JEP 462 â€“ Structured Concurrency (Second Preview) Improves thread lifecycle management and simplifies parallel processing. This is huge for backend services needing concurrency without chaos â€” perfect fit for services deployed via AWS Lambda, ECS, or EKS.ğŸ§± How this strengthens Hexagonal Architecture and DDDJava 24â€™s cleaner syntax and enhanced language constructs allow for: ğŸ”¹ Richer domain modeling without ceremony ğŸ”¹ Easier testing and mocking of application ports ğŸ”¹ Clearer separation of concerns in inbound/outbound adapters ğŸ”¹ Better observability and tracing when paired with AWS services like CloudWatch & X-Rayâ˜ï¸ AWS + Java 24 = Cloud-native powerCombined with AWS, Java 24 enables: âœ… Lighter Lambda functions (faster cold starts with JDK optimizations) âœ… Enhanced developer productivity with CodeWhisperer and Amazon Q Developer âœ… Seamless integration with infrastructure-as-code (CDK, Terraform) and microservices ecosystemsWeâ€™re not just writing code â€” weâ€™re building resilient, scalable ecosystems. Java 24 gives us sharper tools to do that smarter, faster, and cleaner.Are you already experimenting with Java 24? ğŸš€In this stage, weâ€™ll take the system requirements defined in SWE.1 and build a modular, maintainable architecture that steers implementation, testing, and future evolution.Hereâ€™s what to expect:1ï¸âƒ£ Architectural Views Break the system into clear functional blocks and define their responsibilities:ğŸ”¹Main State Machine Manages core logic and coordinates inter-module communication.ğŸ”¹Current Limits Calculator Computes safe charge/discharge thresholds based on real-time data.ğŸ”¹SOC & SOH Estimators Tracks battery state-of-charge and state-of-health.ğŸ”¹Balancing Logic Ensures individual cell voltages stay synchronized.2ï¸âƒ£ Interfaces & Data FlowsMap each domain into software modules/packages with precise contracts: ğŸ”¹ Defined fixed-rate tasks(50 ms â” MainSM, 100 ms â” LimitsCalc, 200 ms â” SOC/SOH estimators, 250 ms â” Balancing) ğŸ”¹ Route signals (voltage, temperature, current) via buses and ZOH blocks ğŸ”¹ Store each signal in the Data Dictionary as ğŸ”„ a MTP Signals: (ImportedExtern (inputs) - ExportedToFile (logging) - Localized (module-internal))3ï¸âƒ£ Modeling & PrototypingLeverage MATLAB/Simulink & Stateflow to:ğŸ”¹Prototype each core module and simulate their interactions.ğŸ”¹Auto-generate architecture diagrams directly from models.ğŸ”¹Run Model Advisor checks for MISRA C compliance, execution efficiency, and RAM usage.4ï¸âƒ£ Verification AlignmentEmbed test hooks and traceability throughout:ğŸ”¹MIL/SIL Test Harnesses for unit, integration, and system-level validation.ğŸ”¹Full Requirements â†” Architecture â†” Test Case traceability matrices.ğŸ”¹Automated test-management reports to track coverage and results.ğŸ” Why it matters A well-crafted software architecture is the backbone of a reliable project â€”it makes implementation easier to develop, verify, and evolve. GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? How have you approached synchronization and reconciliation across devices and backends?Checkout Amethyst Planner - the task app for hashtag#ADHDers the turns to-dos into dopamine.

For many developers, firmware is a given, constraints that must be obeyed in production software.Â â€œBare-Metal Embedded C Programmingâ€ ( Packt , 2025) by Israel Ninsaw Gbati demonstrates, at a fundamental level, how coding firmware by directly activating system microcontrollers should be merely another step in the production process.Â Â The book consists of 18 chapters, starting with the basics, then discussing timers and system peripherals, before briefly touching on power management.Â I recommend this for any developer looking to extract the maximum performance from their coding. hashtag#baremetal hashtag#C hashtag#Software hashtag#firmware hashtag#Packt

Next, kita try module CH376S for this D0WD-v3 ESP32 which this MC very likely act as isolated network device, BUT possibility to send log about isolated network activity via COM, so boleh act sbg intermediary bagi pihak host2 dalam network dia sahaja dengan syarat physical connected dengan driver tertentu (COM) .. cumanya, kena tambah CH376S USB Module storage ntk keep logging â€˜somethingâ€™ and send to â€˜outside worldâ€™ via COM or guna STA sbb AP ntk MC ni xdpt nak implement full NAT Routing Capabilties ..But, this device boleh buat DDOS dengan capture packet, deauther develop by rinisek, could be Deauther ni operate in Layer 2 OSI, which is spam packets, frame injection, MAC Spoofing things, satu WiFi Radio dah boleh, but NAT Routing more to Layer 3 OSI & TCP/UDP ops, kena dual jugak WiFi Radio .. klu sketch Full NAT Implement tak boleh kat DW0D-V3, means sia2 sketch DNS Hijack, imo .. ğŸ˜µâ€ğŸ’«But this device sangat sesuai untuk OT Environment, same like SCADA, ASRS etc untuk logging and update, so dapat reduce penggunaan device yang mahal2 like router yang boleh expose TCP Stack, like my previous experience, 8 Crane Controller update logs to WMS Workload through Outdate MOXA Router, lol .. duit pun kena hentam kaw2 dengan vendor ntk maintenance, lambat satu hal, lagi besar attack surface beranak pinak satu hal .. teringat Moxa OS Zero-Day Exploit (RCE) last year, should fixed already ..hashtag#esp32 hashtag#microcontroller hashtag#learning hashtag#networksecurity

Java 24: More than an update â€” a powerful step forward for modern software architecture. hashtag#LinkedInInsiderBRWith the official release of Java 24, Oracle continues to evolve the platform in ways that directly support today's demands for scalability, modularity, and cloud-native design. For professionals like me who architect systems with Hexagonal Architecture (DDD) and deploy on AWS, this release brings substantial benefits.ğŸš€ Key Features in Java 24:âœ… JEP 447 â€“ Statements before super(...) Allows initialization logic before calling the superclass constructor. This enhances flexibility in rich domain models and simplifies base-class inheritance patterns in DDD.âœ… JEP 456 â€“ Unnamed Variables and Patterns (Preview) Reduces boilerplate when using pattern matching, making business logic cleaner and more expressive.âœ… JEP 459 â€“ String Templates (Second Preview) Provides safe and efficient string interpolation â€” ideal for building dynamic responses, configurations, and messages without complex concatenation.âœ… JEP 460 â€“ Vector API (7th Incubator) Enables data-parallel operations for better performance in compute-heavy tasks â€” relevant for analytics or event-driven systems.âœ… JEP 462 â€“ Structured Concurrency (Second Preview) Improves thread lifecycle management and simplifies parallel processing. This is huge for backend services needing concurrency without chaos â€” perfect fit for services deployed via AWS Lambda, ECS, or EKS.ğŸ§± How this strengthens Hexagonal Architecture and DDDJava 24â€™s cleaner syntax and enhanced language constructs allow for: ğŸ”¹ Richer domain modeling without ceremony ğŸ”¹ Easier testing and mocking of application ports ğŸ”¹ Clearer separation of concerns in inbound/outbound adapters ğŸ”¹ Better observability and tracing when paired with AWS services like CloudWatch & X-Rayâ˜ï¸ AWS + Java 24 = Cloud-native powerCombined with AWS, Java 24 enables: âœ… Lighter Lambda functions (faster cold starts with JDK optimizations) âœ… Enhanced developer productivity with CodeWhisperer and Amazon Q Developer âœ… Seamless integration with infrastructure-as-code (CDK, Terraform) and microservices ecosystemsWeâ€™re not just writing code â€” weâ€™re building resilient, scalable ecosystems. Java 24 gives us sharper tools to do that smarter, faster, and cleaner.Are you already experimenting with Java 24? Whatâ€™s your favorite improvement so far?hashtag#Java24 hashtag#HexagonalArchitecture hashtag#DDD hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#AWS hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#Innovation hashtag#BackendEngineering hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LinkedInInsiderBR

Bravo, Michael Graff et co.! I recently added simple metrics (healthz, traffic, analysis) for a monitoring service while SLOs were being defined by others. But then it got me thinking about how one would monitor dynamic HW/SW elements in a heterogeneous AI Infra fabric, leading to my current investigation of out-of-band management using OpenBMC on an evb-ast2600 board using Qemu-based HW emulation. welcome back Ø¹Ø¯Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠØ¨Ø© ğŸ˜… ğŸš€ Next Step: SWE.2 â€“ From Requirement to Architecture and Model! ğŸš€Iâ€™m thrilled to share the next phase of my MBD diploma project from OS-Academy â€“ : SWE.2 â€“ Software Architecture Design! ğŸš€In this stage, weâ€™ll take the system requirements defined in SWE.1 and build a modular, maintainable architecture that steers implementation, testing, and future evolution.Hereâ€™s what to expect:1ï¸âƒ£ Architectural Views Break the system into clear functional blocks and define their responsibilities:ğŸ”¹Main State Machine Manages core logic and coordinates inter-module communication.ğŸ”¹Current Limits Calculator Computes safe charge/discharge thresholds based on real-time data.ğŸ”¹SOC & SOH Estimators Tracks battery state-of-charge and state-of-health.ğŸ”¹Balancing Logic Ensures individual cell voltages stay synchronized.2ï¸âƒ£ Interfaces & Data FlowsMap each domain into software modules/packages with precise contracts: ğŸ”¹ Defined fixed-rate tasks(50 ms â” MainSM, 100 ms â” LimitsCalc, 200 ms â” SOC/SOH estimators, 250 ms â” Balancing) ğŸ”¹ Route signals (voltage, temperature, current) via buses and ZOH blocks ğŸ”¹ Store each signal in the Data Dictionary as ğŸ”„ a MTP Signals: (ImportedExtern (inputs) - ExportedToFile (logging) - Localized (module-internal))3ï¸âƒ£ Modeling & PrototypingLeverage MATLAB/Simulink & Stateflow to:ğŸ”¹Prototype each core module and simulate their interactions.ğŸ”¹Auto-generate architecture diagrams directly from models.ğŸ”¹Run Model Advisor checks for MISRA C compliance, execution efficiency, and RAM usage.4ï¸âƒ£ Verification AlignmentEmbed test hooks and traceability throughout:ğŸ”¹MIL/SIL Test Harnesses for unit, integration, and system-level validation.ğŸ”¹Full Requirements â†” Architecture â†” Test Case traceability matrices.ğŸ”¹Automated test-management reports to track coverage and results.ğŸ” Why it matters A well-crafted software architecture is the backbone of a reliable project â€”it makes implementation easier to develop, verify, and evolve. By nailing this SWE.2 step, we set ourselves up for smoother integration (SWE.3) and rigorous validation (SWE.4).ğŸ”— the GitHub Repo: https://lnkd.in/dpww-PjNStay tuned for SWE.3, where we dive into detailed design and implementation, plus start exploring our battery and planetary models! ğŸŒğŸ”‹hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#MBD hashtag#VModel hashtag#SWE2 hashtag#EmbeddedSystems hashtag#MATLABSimulink hashtag#BMS

GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? How have you approached synchronization and reconciliation across devices and backends?Checkout Amethyst Planner - the task app for hashtag#ADHDers the turns to-dos into dopamine.

Allows initialization logic before calling the superclass constructor. This is huge for backend services needing concurrency without chaos â€” perfect fit for services deployed via AWS Lambda, ECS, or EKS.ğŸ§± How this strengthens Hexagonal Architecture and DDDJava 24â€™s cleaner syntax and enhanced language constructs allow for: ğŸ”¹ Richer domain modeling without ceremony ğŸ”¹ Easier testing and mocking of application ports ğŸ”¹ Clearer separation of concerns in inbound/outbound adapters ğŸ”¹ Better observability and tracing when paired with AWS services like CloudWatch & X-Rayâ˜ï¸ AWS + Java 24 = Cloud-native powerCombined with AWS, Java 24 enables: âœ… Lighter Lambda functions (faster cold starts with JDK optimizations) âœ… Enhanced developer productivity with CodeWhisperer and Amazon Q Developer âœ… Seamless integration with infrastructure-as-code (CDK, Terraform) and microservices ecosystemsWeâ€™re not just writing code â€” weâ€™re building resilient, scalable ecosystems. Can you really get hired from anywhere in the world?As I learnt, it's one of the toughest questions to answer in the recruitment world. welcome back Ø¹Ø¯Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠØ¨Ø© ğŸ˜… ğŸš€ Next Step: SWE.2 â€“ From Requirement to Architecture and Model! ğŸš€Iâ€™m thrilled to share the next phase of my MBD diploma project from OS-Academy â€“ : SWE.2 â€“ Software Architecture Design! ğŸš€In this stage, weâ€™ll take the system requirements defined in SWE.1 and build a modular, maintainable architecture that steers implementation, testing, and future evolution.Hereâ€™s what to expect:1ï¸âƒ£ Architectural Views Break the system into clear functional blocks and define their responsibilities:ğŸ”¹Main State Machine Manages core logic and coordinates inter-module communication.ğŸ”¹Current Limits Calculator Computes safe charge/discharge thresholds based on real-time data.ğŸ”¹SOC & SOH Estimators Tracks battery state-of-charge and state-of-health.ğŸ”¹Balancing Logic Ensures individual cell voltages stay synchronized.2ï¸âƒ£ Interfaces & Data FlowsMap each domain into software modules/packages with precise contracts: ğŸ”¹ Defined fixed-rate tasks(50 ms â” MainSM, 100 ms â” LimitsCalc, 200 ms â” SOC/SOH estimators, 250 ms â” Balancing) ğŸ”¹ Route signals (voltage, temperature, current) via buses and ZOH blocks ğŸ”¹ Store each signal in the Data Dictionary as ğŸ”„ a MTP Signals: (ImportedExtern (inputs) - ExportedToFile (logging) - Localized (module-internal))3ï¸âƒ£ Modeling & PrototypingLeverage MATLAB/Simulink & Stateflow to:ğŸ”¹Prototype each core module and simulate their interactions.ğŸ”¹Auto-generate architecture diagrams directly from models.ğŸ”¹Run Model Advisor checks for MISRA C compliance, execution efficiency, and RAM usage.4ï¸âƒ£ Verification AlignmentEmbed test hooks and traceability throughout:ğŸ”¹MIL/SIL Test Harnesses for unit, integration, and system-level validation.ğŸ”¹Full Requirements â†” Architecture â†” Test Case traceability matrices.ğŸ”¹Automated test-management reports to track coverage and results.ğŸ” Why it matters A well-crafted software architecture is the backbone of a reliable project â€”it makes implementation easier to develop, verify, and evolve. GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? How have you approached synchronization and reconciliation across devices and backends?Checkout Amethyst Planner - the task app for hashtag#ADHDers the turns to-dos into dopamine.

Allows initialization logic before calling the superclass constructor. This enhances flexibility in rich domain models and simplifies base-class inheritance patterns in DDD.âœ… JEP 456 â€“ Unnamed Variables and Patterns (Preview) Reduces boilerplate when using pattern matching, making business logic cleaner and more expressive.âœ… JEP 459 â€“ String Templates (Second Preview) Provides safe and efficient string interpolation â€” ideal for building dynamic responses, configurations, and messages without complex concatenation.âœ… JEP 460 â€“ Vector API (7th Incubator) Enables data-parallel operations for better performance in compute-heavy tasks â€” relevant for analytics or event-driven systems.âœ… JEP 462 â€“ Structured Concurrency (Second Preview) Improves thread lifecycle management and simplifies parallel processing. This is huge for backend services needing concurrency without chaos â€” perfect fit for services deployed via AWS Lambda, ECS, or EKS.ğŸ§± How this strengthens Hexagonal Architecture and DDDJava 24â€™s cleaner syntax and enhanced language constructs allow for: ğŸ”¹ Richer domain modeling without ceremony ğŸ”¹ Easier testing and mocking of application ports ğŸ”¹ Clearer separation of concerns in inbound/outbound adapters ğŸ”¹ Better observability and tracing when paired with AWS services like CloudWatch & X-Rayâ˜ï¸ AWS + Java 24 = Cloud-native powerCombined with AWS, Java 24 enables: âœ… Lighter Lambda functions (faster cold starts with JDK optimizations) âœ… Enhanced developer productivity with CodeWhisperer and Amazon Q Developer âœ… Seamless integration with infrastructure-as-code (CDK, Terraform) and microservices ecosystemsWeâ€™re not just writing code â€” weâ€™re building resilient, scalable ecosystems. Java 24 gives us sharper tools to do that smarter, faster, and cleaner.Are you already experimenting with Java 24? welcome back Ø¹Ø¯Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠØ¨Ø© ğŸ˜… ğŸš€ Next Step: SWE.2 â€“ From Requirement to Architecture and Model! ğŸš€Iâ€™m thrilled to share the next phase of my MBD diploma project from OS-Academy â€“ : SWE.2 â€“ Software Architecture Design! ğŸš€In this stage, weâ€™ll take the system requirements defined in SWE.1 and build a modular, maintainable architecture that steers implementation, testing, and future evolution.Hereâ€™s what to expect:1ï¸âƒ£ Architectural Views Break the system into clear functional blocks and define their responsibilities:ğŸ”¹Main State Machine Manages core logic and coordinates inter-module communication.ğŸ”¹Current Limits Calculator Computes safe charge/discharge thresholds based on real-time data.ğŸ”¹SOC & SOH Estimators Tracks battery state-of-charge and state-of-health.ğŸ”¹Balancing Logic Ensures individual cell voltages stay synchronized.2ï¸âƒ£ Interfaces & Data FlowsMap each domain into software modules/packages with precise contracts: ğŸ”¹ Defined fixed-rate tasks(50 ms â” MainSM, 100 ms â” LimitsCalc, 200 ms â” SOC/SOH estimators, 250 ms â” Balancing) ğŸ”¹ Route signals (voltage, temperature, current) via buses and ZOH blocks ğŸ”¹ Store each signal in the Data Dictionary as ğŸ”„ a MTP Signals: (ImportedExtern (inputs) - ExportedToFile (logging) - Localized (module-internal))3ï¸âƒ£ Modeling & PrototypingLeverage MATLAB/Simulink & Stateflow to:ğŸ”¹Prototype each core module and simulate their interactions.ğŸ”¹Auto-generate architecture diagrams directly from models.ğŸ”¹Run Model Advisor checks for MISRA C compliance, execution efficiency, and RAM usage.4ï¸âƒ£ Verification AlignmentEmbed test hooks and traceability throughout:ğŸ”¹MIL/SIL Test Harnesses for unit, integration, and system-level validation.ğŸ”¹Full Requirements â†” Architecture â†” Test Case traceability matrices.ğŸ”¹Automated test-management reports to track coverage and results.ğŸ” Why it matters A well-crafted software architecture is the backbone of a reliable project â€”it makes implementation easier to develop, verify, and evolve. GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? How have you approached synchronization and reconciliation across devices and backends?Checkout Amethyst Planner - the task app for hashtag#ADHDers the turns to-dos into dopamine.

Java 24: More than an update â€” a powerful step forward for modern software architecture. hashtag#LinkedInInsiderBRWith the official release of Java 24, Oracle continues to evolve the platform in ways that directly support today's demands for scalability, modularity, and cloud-native design. For professionals like me who architect systems with Hexagonal Architecture (DDD) and deploy on AWS, this release brings substantial benefits.ğŸš€ Key Features in Java 24:âœ… JEP 447 â€“ Statements before super(...) Allows initialization logic before calling the superclass constructor. This enhances flexibility in rich domain models and simplifies base-class inheritance patterns in DDD.âœ… JEP 456 â€“ Unnamed Variables and Patterns (Preview) Reduces boilerplate when using pattern matching, making business logic cleaner and more expressive.âœ… JEP 459 â€“ String Templates (Second Preview) Provides safe and efficient string interpolation â€” ideal for building dynamic responses, configurations, and messages without complex concatenation.âœ… JEP 460 â€“ Vector API (7th Incubator) Enables data-parallel operations for better performance in compute-heavy tasks â€” relevant for analytics or event-driven systems.âœ… JEP 462 â€“ Structured Concurrency (Second Preview) Improves thread lifecycle management and simplifies parallel processing. This is huge for backend services needing concurrency without chaos â€” perfect fit for services deployed via AWS Lambda, ECS, or EKS.ğŸ§± How this strengthens Hexagonal Architecture and DDDJava 24â€™s cleaner syntax and enhanced language constructs allow for: ğŸ”¹ Richer domain modeling without ceremony ğŸ”¹ Easier testing and mocking of application ports ğŸ”¹ Clearer separation of concerns in inbound/outbound adapters ğŸ”¹ Better observability and tracing when paired with AWS services like CloudWatch & X-Rayâ˜ï¸ AWS + Java 24 = Cloud-native powerCombined with AWS, Java 24 enables: âœ… Lighter Lambda functions (faster cold starts with JDK optimizations) âœ… Enhanced developer productivity with CodeWhisperer and Amazon Q Developer âœ… Seamless integration with infrastructure-as-code (CDK, Terraform) and microservices ecosystemsWeâ€™re not just writing code â€” weâ€™re building resilient, scalable ecosystems. Java 24 gives us sharper tools to do that smarter, faster, and cleaner.Are you already experimenting with Java 24? welcome back Ø¹Ø¯Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠØ¨Ø© ğŸ˜… ğŸš€ Next Step: SWE.2 â€“ From Requirement to Architecture and Model! ğŸš€Iâ€™m thrilled to share the next phase of my MBD diploma project from OS-Academy â€“ : SWE.2 â€“ Software Architecture Design! ğŸš€In this stage, weâ€™ll take the system requirements defined in SWE.1 and build a modular, maintainable architecture that steers implementation, testing, and future evolution.Hereâ€™s what to expect:1ï¸âƒ£ Architectural Views Break the system into clear functional blocks and define their responsibilities:ğŸ”¹Main State Machine Manages core logic and coordinates inter-module communication.ğŸ”¹Current Limits Calculator Computes safe charge/discharge thresholds based on real-time data.ğŸ”¹SOC & SOH Estimators Tracks battery state-of-charge and state-of-health.ğŸ”¹Balancing Logic Ensures individual cell voltages stay synchronized.2ï¸âƒ£ Interfaces & Data FlowsMap each domain into software modules/packages with precise contracts: ğŸ”¹ Defined fixed-rate tasks(50 ms â” MainSM, 100 ms â” LimitsCalc, 200 ms â” SOC/SOH estimators, 250 ms â” Balancing) ğŸ”¹ Route signals (voltage, temperature, current) via buses and ZOH blocks ğŸ”¹ Store each signal in the Data Dictionary as ğŸ”„ a MTP Signals: (ImportedExtern (inputs) - ExportedToFile (logging) - Localized (module-internal))3ï¸âƒ£ Modeling & PrototypingLeverage MATLAB/Simulink & Stateflow to:ğŸ”¹Prototype each core module and simulate their interactions.ğŸ”¹Auto-generate architecture diagrams directly from models.ğŸ”¹Run Model Advisor checks for MISRA C compliance, execution efficiency, and RAM usage.4ï¸âƒ£ Verification AlignmentEmbed test hooks and traceability throughout:ğŸ”¹MIL/SIL Test Harnesses for unit, integration, and system-level validation.ğŸ”¹Full Requirements â†” Architecture â†” Test Case traceability matrices.ğŸ”¹Automated test-management reports to track coverage and results.ğŸ” Why it matters A well-crafted software architecture is the backbone of a reliable project â€”it makes implementation easier to develop, verify, and evolve. By nailing this SWE.2 step, we set ourselves up for smoother integration (SWE.3) and rigorous validation (SWE.4).ğŸ”— the GitHub Repo: https://lnkd.in/dpww-PjNStay tuned for SWE.3, where we dive into detailed design and implementation, plus start exploring our battery and planetary models! ğŸŒğŸ”‹hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#MBD hashtag#VModel hashtag#SWE2 hashtag#EmbeddedSystems hashtag#MATLABSimulink hashtag#BMS

GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? How have you approached synchronization and reconciliation across devices and backends?Checkout Amethyst Planner - the task app for hashtag#ADHDers the turns to-dos into dopamine.

Java 24: More than an update â€” a powerful step forward for modern software architecture. hashtag#LinkedInInsiderBRWith the official release of Java 24, Oracle continues to evolve the platform in ways that directly support today's demands for scalability, modularity, and cloud-native design. For professionals like me who architect systems with Hexagonal Architecture (DDD) and deploy on AWS, this release brings substantial benefits.ğŸš€ Key Features in Java 24:âœ… JEP 447 â€“ Statements before super(...) Allows initialization logic before calling the superclass constructor. This enhances flexibility in rich domain models and simplifies base-class inheritance patterns in DDD.âœ… JEP 456 â€“ Unnamed Variables and Patterns (Preview) Reduces boilerplate when using pattern matching, making business logic cleaner and more expressive.âœ… JEP 459 â€“ String Templates (Second Preview) Provides safe and efficient string interpolation â€” ideal for building dynamic responses, configurations, and messages without complex concatenation.âœ… JEP 460 â€“ Vector API (7th Incubator) Enables data-parallel operations for better performance in compute-heavy tasks â€” relevant for analytics or event-driven systems.âœ… JEP 462 â€“ Structured Concurrency (Second Preview) Improves thread lifecycle management and simplifies parallel processing. This is huge for backend services needing concurrency without chaos â€” perfect fit for services deployed via AWS Lambda, ECS, or EKS.ğŸ§± How this strengthens Hexagonal Architecture and DDDJava 24â€™s cleaner syntax and enhanced language constructs allow for: ğŸ”¹ Richer domain modeling without ceremony ğŸ”¹ Easier testing and mocking of application ports ğŸ”¹ Clearer separation of concerns in inbound/outbound adapters ğŸ”¹ Better observability and tracing when paired with AWS services like CloudWatch & X-Rayâ˜ï¸ AWS + Java 24 = Cloud-native powerCombined with AWS, Java 24 enables: âœ… Lighter Lambda functions (faster cold starts with JDK optimizations) âœ… Enhanced developer productivity with CodeWhisperer and Amazon Q Developer âœ… Seamless integration with infrastructure-as-code (CDK, Terraform) and microservices ecosystemsWeâ€™re not just writing code â€” weâ€™re building resilient, scalable ecosystems. Java 24 gives us sharper tools to do that smarter, faster, and cleaner.Are you already experimenting with Java 24? Whatâ€™s your favorite improvement so far?hashtag#Java24 hashtag#HexagonalArchitecture hashtag#DDD hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#AWS hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#Innovation hashtag#BackendEngineering hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LinkedInInsiderBR

welcome back Ø¹Ø¯Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠØ¨Ø© ğŸ˜… ğŸš€ Next Step: SWE.2 â€“ From Requirement to Architecture and Model! ğŸš€Iâ€™m thrilled to share the next phase of my MBD diploma project from OS-Academy â€“ : SWE.2 â€“ Software Architecture Design! ğŸš€In this stage, weâ€™ll take the system requirements defined in SWE.1 and build a modular, maintainable architecture that steers implementation, testing, and future evolution.Hereâ€™s what to expect:1ï¸âƒ£ Architectural Views Break the system into clear functional blocks and define their responsibilities:ğŸ”¹Main State Machine Manages core logic and coordinates inter-module communication.ğŸ”¹Current Limits Calculator Computes safe charge/discharge thresholds based on real-time data.ğŸ”¹SOC & SOH Estimators Tracks battery state-of-charge and state-of-health.ğŸ”¹Balancing Logic Ensures individual cell voltages stay synchronized.2ï¸âƒ£ Interfaces & Data FlowsMap each domain into software modules/packages with precise contracts: ğŸ”¹ Defined fixed-rate tasks(50 ms â” MainSM, 100 ms â” LimitsCalc, 200 ms â” SOC/SOH estimators, 250 ms â” Balancing) ğŸ”¹ Route signals (voltage, temperature, current) via buses and ZOH blocks ğŸ”¹ Store each signal in the Data Dictionary as ğŸ”„ a MTP Signals: (ImportedExtern (inputs) - ExportedToFile (logging) - Localized (module-internal))3ï¸âƒ£ Modeling & PrototypingLeverage MATLAB/Simulink & Stateflow to:ğŸ”¹Prototype each core module and simulate their interactions.ğŸ”¹Auto-generate architecture diagrams directly from models.ğŸ”¹Run Model Advisor checks for MISRA C compliance, execution efficiency, and RAM usage.4ï¸âƒ£ Verification AlignmentEmbed test hooks and traceability throughout:ğŸ”¹MIL/SIL Test Harnesses for unit, integration, and system-level validation.ğŸ”¹Full Requirements â†” Architecture â†” Test Case traceability matrices.ğŸ”¹Automated test-management reports to track coverage and results.ğŸ” Why it matters A well-crafted software architecture is the backbone of a reliable project â€”it makes implementation easier to develop, verify, and evolve. By nailing this SWE.2 step, we set ourselves up for smoother integration (SWE.3) and rigorous validation (SWE.4).ğŸ”— the GitHub Repo: https://lnkd.in/dpww-PjNStay tuned for SWE.3, where we dive into detailed design and implementation, plus start exploring our battery and planetary models! ğŸŒğŸ”‹hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#MBD hashtag#VModel hashtag#SWE2 hashtag#EmbeddedSystems hashtag#MATLABSimulink hashtag#BMS

GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? How have you approached synchronization and reconciliation across devices and backends?Checkout Amethyst Planner - the task app for hashtag#ADHDers the turns to-dos into dopamine.

Java 24: More than an update â€” a powerful step forward for modern software architecture. hashtag#LinkedInInsiderBRWith the official release of Java 24, Oracle continues to evolve the platform in ways that directly support today's demands for scalability, modularity, and cloud-native design. For professionals like me who architect systems with Hexagonal Architecture (DDD) and deploy on AWS, this release brings substantial benefits.ğŸš€ Key Features in Java 24:âœ… JEP 447 â€“ Statements before super(...) Allows initialization logic before calling the superclass constructor. This enhances flexibility in rich domain models and simplifies base-class inheritance patterns in DDD.âœ… JEP 456 â€“ Unnamed Variables and Patterns (Preview) Reduces boilerplate when using pattern matching, making business logic cleaner and more expressive.âœ… JEP 459 â€“ String Templates (Second Preview) Provides safe and efficient string interpolation â€” ideal for building dynamic responses, configurations, and messages without complex concatenation.âœ… JEP 460 â€“ Vector API (7th Incubator) Enables data-parallel operations for better performance in compute-heavy tasks â€” relevant for analytics or event-driven systems.âœ… JEP 462 â€“ Structured Concurrency (Second Preview) Improves thread lifecycle management and simplifies parallel processing. This is huge for backend services needing concurrency without chaos â€” perfect fit for services deployed via AWS Lambda, ECS, or EKS.ğŸ§± How this strengthens Hexagonal Architecture and DDDJava 24â€™s cleaner syntax and enhanced language constructs allow for: ğŸ”¹ Richer domain modeling without ceremony ğŸ”¹ Easier testing and mocking of application ports ğŸ”¹ Clearer separation of concerns in inbound/outbound adapters ğŸ”¹ Better observability and tracing when paired with AWS services like CloudWatch & X-Rayâ˜ï¸ AWS + Java 24 = Cloud-native powerCombined with AWS, Java 24 enables: âœ… Lighter Lambda functions (faster cold starts with JDK optimizations) âœ… Enhanced developer productivity with CodeWhisperer and Amazon Q Developer âœ… Seamless integration with infrastructure-as-code (CDK, Terraform) and microservices ecosystemsWeâ€™re not just writing code â€” weâ€™re building resilient, scalable ecosystems. Java 24 gives us sharper tools to do that smarter, faster, and cleaner.Are you already experimenting with Java 24? Whatâ€™s your favorite improvement so far?hashtag#Java24 hashtag#HexagonalArchitecture hashtag#DDD hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#AWS hashtag#CloudNative hashtag#Innovation hashtag#BackendEngineering hashtag#Leadership hashtag#LinkedInInsiderBR

welcome back Ø¹Ø¯Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠØ¨Ø© ğŸ˜… ğŸš€ Next Step: SWE.2 â€“ From Requirement to Architecture and Model! ğŸš€Iâ€™m thrilled to share the next phase of my MBD diploma project from OS-Academy â€“ : SWE.2 â€“ Software Architecture Design! ğŸš€In this stage, weâ€™ll take the system requirements defined in SWE.1 and build a modular, maintainable architecture that steers implementation, testing, and future evolution.Hereâ€™s what to expect:1ï¸âƒ£ Architectural Views Break the system into clear functional blocks and define their responsibilities:ğŸ”¹Main State Machine Manages core logic and coordinates inter-module communication.ğŸ”¹Current Limits Calculator Computes safe charge/discharge thresholds based on real-time data.ğŸ”¹SOC & SOH Estimators Tracks battery state-of-charge and state-of-health.ğŸ”¹Balancing Logic Ensures individual cell voltages stay synchronized.2ï¸âƒ£ Interfaces & Data FlowsMap each domain into software modules/packages with precise contracts: ğŸ”¹ Defined fixed-rate tasks(50 ms â” MainSM, 100 ms â” LimitsCalc, 200 ms â” SOC/SOH estimators, 250 ms â” Balancing) ğŸ”¹ Route signals (voltage, temperature, current) via buses and ZOH blocks ğŸ”¹ Store each signal in the Data Dictionary as ğŸ”„ a MTP Signals: (ImportedExtern (inputs) - ExportedToFile (logging) - Localized (module-internal))3ï¸âƒ£ Modeling & PrototypingLeverage MATLAB/Simulink & Stateflow to:ğŸ”¹Prototype each core module and simulate their interactions.ğŸ”¹Auto-generate architecture diagrams directly from models.ğŸ”¹Run Model Advisor checks for MISRA C compliance, execution efficiency, and RAM usage.4ï¸âƒ£ Verification AlignmentEmbed test hooks and traceability throughout:ğŸ”¹MIL/SIL Test Harnesses for unit, integration, and system-level validation.ğŸ”¹Full Requirements â†” Architecture â†” Test Case traceability matrices.ğŸ”¹Automated test-management reports to track coverage and results.ğŸ” Why it matters A well-crafted software architecture is the backbone of a reliable project â€”it makes implementation easier to develop, verify, and evolve. GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? How have you approached synchronization and reconciliation across devices and backends?Checkout Amethyst Planner - the task app for hashtag#ADHDers the turns to-dos into dopamine.

Java 24: More than an update â€” a powerful step forward for modern software architecture. hashtag#LinkedInInsiderBRWith the official release of Java 24, Oracle continues to evolve the platform in ways that directly support today's demands for scalability, modularity, and cloud-native design. For professionals like me who architect systems with Hexagonal Architecture (DDD) and deploy on AWS, this release brings substantial benefits.ğŸš€ Key Features in Java 24:âœ… JEP 447 â€“ Statements before super(...) Allows initialization logic before calling the superclass constructor. This enhances flexibility in rich domain models and simplifies base-class inheritance patterns in DDD.âœ… JEP 456 â€“ Unnamed Variables and Patterns (Preview) Reduces boilerplate when using pattern matching, making business logic cleaner and more expressive.âœ… JEP 459 â€“ String Templates (Second Preview) Provides safe and efficient string interpolation â€” ideal for building dynamic responses, configurations, and messages without complex concatenation.âœ… JEP 460 â€“ Vector API (7th Incubator) Enables data-parallel operations for better performance in compute-heavy tasks â€” relevant for analytics or event-driven systems.âœ… JEP 462 â€“ Structured Concurrency (Second Preview) Improves thread lifecycle management and simplifies parallel processing. This is huge for backend services needing concurrency without chaos â€” perfect fit for services deployed via AWS Lambda, ECS, or EKS.ğŸ§± How this strengthens Hexagonal Architecture and DDDJava 24â€™s cleaner syntax and enhanced language constructs allow for: ğŸ”¹ Richer domain modeling without ceremony ğŸ”¹ Easier testing and mocking of application ports ğŸ”¹ Clearer separation of concerns in inbound/outbound adapters ğŸ”¹ Better observability and tracing when paired with AWS services like CloudWatch & X-Rayâ˜ï¸ AWS + Java 24 = Cloud-native powerCombined with AWS, Java 24 enables: âœ… Lighter Lambda functions (faster cold starts with JDK optimizations) âœ… Enhanced developer productivity with CodeWhisperer and Amazon Q Developer âœ… Seamless integration with infrastructure-as-code (CDK, Terraform) and microservices ecosystemsWeâ€™re not just writing code â€” weâ€™re building resilient, scalable ecosystems. Java 24 gives us sharper tools to do that smarter, faster, and cleaner.Are you already experimenting with Java 24? welcome back Ø¹Ø¯Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠØ¨Ø© ğŸ˜… ğŸš€ Next Step: SWE.2 â€“ From Requirement to Architecture and Model! ğŸš€Iâ€™m thrilled to share the next phase of my MBD diploma project from OS-Academy â€“ : SWE.2 â€“ Software Architecture Design! ğŸš€In this stage, weâ€™ll take the system requirements defined in SWE.1 and build a modular, maintainable architecture that steers implementation, testing, and future evolution.Hereâ€™s what to expect:1ï¸âƒ£ Architectural Views Break the system into clear functional blocks and define their responsibilities:ğŸ”¹Main State Machine Manages core logic and coordinates inter-module communication.ğŸ”¹Current Limits Calculator Computes safe charge/discharge thresholds based on real-time data.ğŸ”¹SOC & SOH Estimators Tracks battery state-of-charge and state-of-health.ğŸ”¹Balancing Logic Ensures individual cell voltages stay synchronized.2ï¸âƒ£ Interfaces & Data FlowsMap each domain into software modules/packages with precise contracts: ğŸ”¹ Defined fixed-rate tasks(50 ms â” MainSM, 100 ms â” LimitsCalc, 200 ms â” SOC/SOH estimators, 250 ms â” Balancing) ğŸ”¹ Route signals (voltage, temperature, current) via buses and ZOH blocks ğŸ”¹ Store each signal in the Data Dictionary as ğŸ”„ a MTP Signals: (ImportedExtern (inputs) - ExportedToFile (logging) - Localized (module-internal))3ï¸âƒ£ Modeling & PrototypingLeverage MATLAB/Simulink & Stateflow to:ğŸ”¹Prototype each core module and simulate their interactions.ğŸ”¹Auto-generate architecture diagrams directly from models.ğŸ”¹Run Model Advisor checks for MISRA C compliance, execution efficiency, and RAM usage.4ï¸âƒ£ Verification AlignmentEmbed test hooks and traceability throughout:ğŸ”¹MIL/SIL Test Harnesses for unit, integration, and system-level validation.ğŸ”¹Full Requirements â†” Architecture â†” Test Case traceability matrices.ğŸ”¹Automated test-management reports to track coverage and results.ğŸ” Why it matters A well-crafted software architecture is the backbone of a reliable project â€”it makes implementation easier to develop, verify, and evolve. GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? How have you approached synchronization and reconciliation across devices and backends?Checkout Amethyst Planner - the task app for hashtag#ADHDers the turns to-dos into dopamine.

Java 24: More than an update â€” a powerful step forward for modern software architecture. hashtag#LinkedInInsiderBRWith the official release of Java 24, Oracle continues to evolve the platform in ways that directly support today's demands for scalability, modularity, and cloud-native design. For professionals like me who architect systems with Hexagonal Architecture (DDD) and deploy on AWS, this release brings substantial benefits.ğŸš€ Key Features in Java 24:âœ… JEP 447 â€“ Statements before super(...) Allows initialization logic before calling the superclass constructor. This enhances flexibility in rich domain models and simplifies base-class inheritance patterns in DDD.âœ… JEP 456 â€“ Unnamed Variables and Patterns (Preview) Reduces boilerplate when using pattern matching, making business logic cleaner and more expressive.âœ… JEP 459 â€“ String Templates (Second Preview) Provides safe and efficient string interpolation â€” ideal for building dynamic responses, configurations, and messages without complex concatenation.âœ… JEP 460 â€“ Vector API (7th Incubator) Enables data-parallel operations for better performance in compute-heavy tasks â€” relevant for analytics or event-driven systems.âœ… JEP 462 â€“ Structured Concurrency (Second Preview) Improves thread lifecycle management and simplifies parallel processing. This is huge for backend services needing concurrency without chaos â€” perfect fit for services deployed via AWS Lambda, ECS, or EKS.ğŸ§± How this strengthens Hexagonal Architecture and DDDJava 24â€™s cleaner syntax and enhanced language constructs allow for: ğŸ”¹ Richer domain modeling without ceremony ğŸ”¹ Easier testing and mocking of application ports ğŸ”¹ Clearer separation of concerns in inbound/outbound adapters ğŸ”¹ Better observability and tracing when paired with AWS services like CloudWatch & X-Rayâ˜ï¸ AWS + Java 24 = Cloud-native powerCombined with AWS, Java 24 enables: âœ… Lighter Lambda functions (faster cold starts with JDK optimizations) âœ… Enhanced developer productivity with CodeWhisperer and Amazon Q Developer âœ… Seamless integration with infrastructure-as-code (CDK, Terraform) and microservices ecosystemsWeâ€™re not just writing code â€” weâ€™re building resilient, scalable ecosystems. Java 24 gives us sharper tools to do that smarter, faster, and cleaner.Are you already experimenting with Java 24? welcome back Ø¹Ø¯Ù†Ø§ Ø¨Ø¹Ø¯ Ø§Ù„ØºÙŠØ¨Ø© ğŸ˜… ğŸš€ Next Step: SWE.2 â€“ From Requirement to Architecture and Model! ğŸš€Iâ€™m thrilled to share the next phase of my MBD diploma project from OS-Academy â€“ : SWE.2 â€“ Software Architecture Design! ğŸš€In this stage, weâ€™ll take the system requirements defined in SWE.1 and build a modular, maintainable architecture that steers implementation, testing, and future evolution.Hereâ€™s what to expect:1ï¸âƒ£ Architectural Views Break the system into clear functional blocks and define their responsibilities:ğŸ”¹Main State Machine Manages core logic and coordinates inter-module communication.ğŸ”¹Current Limits Calculator Computes safe charge/discharge thresholds based on real-time data.ğŸ”¹SOC & SOH Estimators Tracks battery state-of-charge and state-of-health.ğŸ”¹Balancing Logic Ensures individual cell voltages stay synchronized.2ï¸âƒ£ Interfaces & Data FlowsMap each domain into software modules/packages with precise contracts: ğŸ”¹ Defined fixed-rate tasks(50 ms â” MainSM, 100 ms â” LimitsCalc, 200 ms â” SOC/SOH estimators, 250 ms â” Balancing) ğŸ”¹ Route signals (voltage, temperature, current) via buses and ZOH blocks ğŸ”¹ Store each signal in the Data Dictionary as ğŸ”„ a MTP Signals: (ImportedExtern (inputs) - ExportedToFile (logging) - Localized (module-internal))3ï¸âƒ£ Modeling & PrototypingLeverage MATLAB/Simulink & Stateflow to:ğŸ”¹Prototype each core module and simulate their interactions.ğŸ”¹Auto-generate architecture diagrams directly from models.ğŸ”¹Run Model Advisor checks for MISRA C compliance, execution efficiency, and RAM usage.4ï¸âƒ£ Verification AlignmentEmbed test hooks and traceability throughout:ğŸ”¹MIL/SIL Test Harnesses for unit, integration, and system-level validation.ğŸ”¹Full Requirements â†” Architecture â†” Test Case traceability matrices.ğŸ”¹Automated test-management reports to track coverage and results.ğŸ” Why it matters A well-crafted software architecture is the backbone of a reliable project â€”it makes implementation easier to develop, verify, and evolve. By nailing this SWE.2 step, we set ourselves up for smoother integration (SWE.3) and rigorous validation (SWE.4).ğŸ”— the GitHub Repo: https://lnkd.in/dpww-PjNStay tuned for SWE.3, where we dive into detailed design and implementation, plus start exploring our battery and planetary models! ğŸŒğŸ”‹hashtag#SoftwareArchitecture hashtag#MBD hashtag#VModel hashtag#SWE2 hashtag#EmbeddedSystems hashtag#MATLABSimulink hashtag#BMS

GCC15 is out, with prime path coverage! I wrote a paper about the my implementation, the algorithm, and some new developments; notably, that prime path coverage subsumes MC/DC, and that using suffix trees for recording paths can eliminate redundant paths very quickly -- O(nÂ²m) down from O(nÂ²mÂ²), where n is the length of the longest path, and m is the number of paths. This is makes pruning redundant paths very quick as n tends to be small, and m tends to be very large.

Up until recently Amethyst Planner stored everything locally on the user's device. Unfortunately this meant that the user couldn't use the app across multiple devices (or easy switch to a new device).I was surprised to find there wasn't an existing plugin for sync'ing data between Hive and a backend API. We ended up creating TimestampedBox that wraps a Hive Box and provides all the timestamps to support the sync operation. What do you think? How have you approached synchronization and reconciliation across devices and backends?Checkout Amethyst Planner - the task app for hashtag#ADHDers the turns to-dos into dopamine.
